file_content.text: [Establishing uplink with Imperial Command.]
Commander Calum speaking.
I see nothing escapes you, my lord--including the location of Operations Group Two's base. What is their status?
I'm impressed, agent. You've discovered Operations Group Two's base. What is their status?
Good work, hunter. I see you've tracked down Operations Group Two's camp. What is their status?
Excellent work. I feared we'd never find Operations Group Two's camp. Tell me--what is their status?
Dead. Every last one.
All that's left is this datapad. The records are encrypted.
Standard black ops protocol. Upload the data, and I'll decode it.
Let me see.... Confidential report, mission to rescue the Dread Masters... ah. Here we are.
According to this log, Operations Group One set out to free the Sith. Group Two stayed behind to secure their escape. Then they were attacked.
Their wounds were carved with fury. The Republic couldn't stomach this.
But not by the Republic.
This massacre reeks of hatred. Too brutal for Republic work.
But not by the Republic.
Military operations are precise, organized. This fight was personal.
The Republic didn't do this.
Whoever hit your boys got in close. Quick, clean and brutal. Not exactly the Republic's style.
This isn't Republic work.
Only the Esh-kha could cause this much destruction.
The Esh-kha. You're right, of course.
There is only one other possibility: the Esh-kha.
Your men were black ops. A massacre like this is embarrassing.
They should've been prepared.
They were prepared to deflect the Republic. But this--this bears the mark of the Esh-kha.
What could have wiped out an entire unit of Imperial commandos?
Attacked by who?
Judging by these records, an unidentified alien species is responsible. That can mean only one thing: the Esh-kha.
Whoever did this will suffer.
The culprits must be punished.
Excellent. Judging by these records, an unidentified alien species ambushed Group Two. I believe we have the Esh-kha to thank.
It's payback time.
But I fear the Republic isn't to blame. This attack bears the mark of the Esh-kha.
You may have stopped their escape before, but many still roam free. And they're growing stronger.
You may have faced them once before. But this time the stakes are higher.
They're an ancient conqueror species, incarcerated here for thousands of years. Now they're on the loose and out for blood.
In the name of the Emperor, I'm asking for your assistance, my lord. Help us rescue the Dread Masters. Before the Esh-kha destroy them.
I'm declaring a planet-wide emergency. Please, agent--use any means necessary to secure the Dread Masters' safety.
I'm officially placing a bounty on the Dread Masters. Ensure their safety, and you will receive riches from the Emperor's personal treasury.
I'm declaring a planet-wide emergency. The Emperor asks that you rescue the Dread Masters immediately. Their safety takes priority.
The Sith Lords will live to serve the Empire again.
Leave the Dread Masters to me.
I could use some company terrorizing the Republic.
I'll gladly free them.
The Dread Masters will soon be in Imperial custody.
Consider it done.
Excellent. Do this, and our operations on Belsavis will finally succeed.
I'll get your Sith. Just be ready with my pay.
I'm on it.
Of course, hunter. The Empire will gladly oblige.
If the Dread Masters are so powerful, couldn't they terrorize the Esh-kha into submission?
Can't these Sith fight back?
Republic medication keeps the Dread Masters docile. But act fast and you may yet witness their power.
I'll handle it, if you can't.
According to the intel you recovered, Operations Group One left for vault 914. That's where the Republic jailed the Dread Masters.
Locate them at once. And if you encounter Esh-kha, show them no mercy.
The Emperor will hear of this.
[The corpse appears to be a member of the missing Operations Group Two.]
[An encrypted datapad found on the body may shed some light on the situation.]
[Commander Calum should be informed of this massacre.]
